inn1.comm: on a length, at off stump, defended to the off side
touch shorter of a length, and straighter, Cook tucks it into midwicket to get England's 'new era' up and running
touch of fortune for Bell, this nips back off the seam and takes a thick outside edge which scuttles past the stumps and beats short fine-leg
gets a small stride forward and defends to the off side
full and straight, defended towards mid-on
wider outside off, touch of swing, left alone
back of a length, punched off the back foot to cover
drifts onto leg stump, whipped off the pads by Cook behind square on the leg side...outfield a little sluggish, no surprise, and deep square gets around
dragged down short, this time he gets the timing and the placement as he pulls it backward of square...just helped in around the corner, not enough pace to drop short
gets it fuller, cut into the off side
pushed down the leg side, Cook flicks but doesn't make contact...not a great start from Evans
this is short of a length again, squats a little on Cook and doesn't quite come onto the bat but he watches it closely and pulls through midwicket
starts to walk at the bowler, it's a length ball outside off, he opens the face and guides to third man
good delivery, full on off stump, defended
angled into the pads, clipped through midwicket but mid-on gets around to keep them to a single
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
neatly flicked off around middle stump into the square-leg area
short of a length, Bell tries to open the face but can't beat backward point
nice use of the wrists, flicks it off the stumps and places it wide enough of deep square for a second
cut to backward point, good diving save...was quite tight to Cook and he couldn't quite free his arms
loses his length again, pulled down short, fetched in front of square by Cook
nowt for short on here, Bell pulls behind square and beats the deep square fielder this time
that's more like it, full outside off, Bell comes forward to drive and the ball takes a thick outside edge through gully down to third man
misses out on a hint of width outside off, his cut shot goes straight into the ground and bobbles to point
full and down the leg side, but that must have clipped the pad...half an appeal from the keeper
flicked off leg stump to deep square
he's been strong off his pads so far and he picks off another boundary as Wardlaw, this time, drifts onto leg stump and gets put away wide of short fine-leg
now he brings out something more aggressive, flicks a length delivery through midwicket and wide of mid-on with plenty of bottom hand
tries to pull again, but this delivery was fuller and he gets a bottom edge into his pad
full and driven to mid-off, Cook sets off immediately and makes the run comfortably
pushed into the off side
glides a length delivery outside off to third man
takes Cook on the thigh pad as he aims to the leg side
short on leg stump, almost through the shot early as he pulls to square leg
comes at the bowler then flicks it along the ground into midwicket
gets beaten over the top edge as he tries to run it down to third man...touch more bounce from Davey
driven on the up, cleanly struck but he picks over cover
full outside off, Bell drags it onto the on side down to long-on
round the wicket to Cook, dabbed into the leg side
full at leg stump, whipped out to deep midwicket
uses his feet, floated up tantalisingly so by Haq, Bell picks out cover as he drives
now he reverses sweeps, trying to disrupt Haq, but can't be short third man
uses his feet again, which ends up making this into a yorker which he can only jab to midwicket...good start from Haq
just short! Cook is early, aiming into the leg side, and flicks the ball towards midwicket but doesn't quite carry
flash and a miss outside off

short again! This looked like the first wicket for certain. Cook squared up by a length delivery, aiming for the leg side again, gets a fat leading edge but it falls short of Coetzer running from mid-off
pushed towards mid-on, a scampered single
now an edge for Bell, he was again walking at the bowler, went to turn this through midwicket and it almost takes the back of the bat to third man
more control in this short, full on off stump, whipped along the ground through midwicket
nicely bowled again, 48mph, just grips on the surface as Bell dabs into the off side
almost done in the flight, held back again by Haq and Cook is early on his shot which pops into midwicket...mid-on loses his footing as he runs around, slips and that could have been nasty
whipped out to deep midwicket
handsome strike this time, advances down the pitch and holds his shape as he drives clear over long-off...classical stroke. Didn't try to hit it too hard
reverse sweep again and this time it's successful as he gets it fine of short third-man...this was wider outside off and allow Bell to a clean strike
worked down to long-on...England regain some momentum
he's starting to flow now, offered some width and he drives on the up through the covers...has enough to counter the slow outfield
short of a length on his hip, flicked behind square on the leg side
full on off stump, steered down to third man
aims something expansive down the ground, gets underneath the ball and it goes a long way up the air...clears mid-on but then plugs in the outfield
full outside off, comes well forward and drives to deep cover
worked into the leg side
round the wicket, dragged down short, pulled firmly towards mid-on
round the wicket, full on the stumps, punched down the ground
speared in very full, Cook can only dig it out back to the bowler
opens his stance a touch this time, drives though cover to long-off
nice piece of placement from Bell, goes outside leg stump to counter the round-the-wicket line and lofts it over the off-side field
reverse sweeps to short third man
lofted straight down the ground, glorious strike down the ground and has the legs to clear the rope
low full toss, flicked through square leg and the deep sweeper slides around his knees...takes Bell to a very neat fifty, continues his impressive form this season
gone now! Gets too far across his crease, tries to lap a fullish delivery through fine leg, misses and all his stumps are exposed
full outside off, gets forward, blocked to cover
oh, what a way to get off the mark, a shimmy down the pitch and he drills a drive wide of mid-off...a punchy shot, barely any followthrough
short of a length, on off stump, defended
back of a length, Cook deep in the crease and works to midwicket
full outside off, fetched with a lot of bottom hand and dragged to midwicket
oh dear, that's a massive full toss...a no-ball for being over a waist height as it slips out to Cook, who pulls to short fine-leg who drops a catch that wouldn't have counted.
cuts and misses outside off
opens the face and runs down to third man
dispatches a length delivery over midwicket, going to the long side of the ground, long-on runs around but can't quite field the slippery ball cleanly at first
short but no timing from Cook as it comes off the splice towards midwicket
gets away with this, Morgan aims a drive over the off side but it skews off a thick outside edge and loops over backward point...falling safe of two men running back
very full, driven down to long-off
gets right across his crease then tries to work a delivery outside off through the leg side...he misses
that's an impressive shot, inside out over the covers but long-off makes excellent ground round the boundary and is helped by the ball plugging in the outfield
huge appeal for caught behind! Given not out. Cook walked across his crease again, whips to leg and is taken by the keeper. Clipped the thigh pad. Keeper checked for the stumping as well
full and nicely placed behind square on the off side with an open face
resumes with a big full toss, probably slipped out, and Morgan plants it over the straight boundary with a crunching blow...not convinced it was entirely out of the middle, but went miles
now he gets a bottom edge on a cut, the ball scurries fine of short third man but is pulled up before the rope
full outside off, Morgan is beaten as he plays over the top of it and Cross can't take it cleanly
comes down the pitch, duffs a drive to cover...his timing on the off side hasn't quite been there today
missed stumping? Yes, it was. Morgan beaten on the inside edge as this drifts in and Cross can't gather. Morgan was well out of his ground
low full toss, but this time drilled firmly back to the bowler
he's timed this one! A straight drive zings off the middle of Cook's bat, straight down the ground, and bisects long-off and long-on

top catch! MacLoed has hauled in a chance that was heading for six. Cook timed another straight drive, just to the off side this time, it was heading flat and fast, MacLoed ran around the ground then dived full length to complete the catch
driven off the back foot to cover
can't find the gap again, pushed firmly into the off side
round the wicket, back of a length, dropped into the off side
another full toss but only costs a single as Morgan clubs to long-on to keep the strike
wide full toss outside off, Morgan was actually giving himself more room outside leg but still managed to reach it and it came off the open face wide of third man
length ball outside off, only connects with fresh air as he aims towards square leg
makes contact this time, the delivery was a little fuller outside off, he picked it up over midwicket but couldn't beat long-on as he ran around the boundary
full outside off, the bat face closes in his hands and the ball runs down to long-off
he places this over the off side, no great power and it almost stops in the outfield
a misfield costs a boundary, Buttler punched a length delivery towards cover but Davey couldn't quite get his hands down in time as he dived
low full toss outside and crisply driven over extra cover, this time there's enough timing to overcome the outfield as it's placed well wide of long-off
better delivery, a wide yorker, driven down to long-off
full outside off, up and over the off side again, long-off runs around although needs to be careful not to slip

another fantastic catch! This looked like six for Buttler, he picked up a length delivery towards deep midwicket but Taylor timed his jump to perfection and then was still able to make sure he didn't step over the boundary
down the pitch, it's delivery wide outside off and he has to reach at full stretch for it
forward on off stump, gently pushes a full delivery down the ground
poor delivery, full toss down the leg side, and the keeper can't stop it either to give away another extra
another one goes! All rather muted. Full and wide outside off, Morgan chases it and gets a top edge to the keeper
away first ball with a boundary, all invention from Root as he shapes to reverse sweep or scoop then gets an inside edge fine of short third man
full and wide down the leg side
full and straight, driven down to long-on
full and straight, swung through the leg side to deep midwicket
gets across his crease and plays a delicate, precision sweep to beat short fine-leg...deftness at its best
now he goes through the off side, full outside off, driven sweetly through the covers...impressive timing and placement
good delivery, full at leg stump, dug out to the off side
that's a crunching blow, back of a length this time and he hammers it straight down the ground over the bowler's end...clean striking

the catching has held up superbly, this time a well-judged low take a deep midwicket as Root flicks a full delivery over the leg side - comes off the toe end of the bat - and Taylor dives forward to grab it
more catching practice...Bopara trying to clear long-on against a low full toss, didn't come out of the middle and this was a simple catch
no hat-trick, Ballance drives a full delivery down to long-off...almost took out Jordan at the non-striker's end
and there's a view of his power...stand and deliver! A length ball, allows Jordan a clean swing, this one finds the middle and it goes gun-barrel straight down the ground

inn2.comm: length ball, sits up on off stump, tapped short on the leg side for a single
Anderson drifts a little wide and MacLeod slaps his first ball dismissively through backward point, sturdy clump and away the ball skips to the boundary
straighter line, worked for one towards midwicket
winds up and fires this down the leg side - wide
stays back and plays the ball down on to the off stump! Anderson got this to seam back at Cross, bounced a little and maybe a touch quicker than expected, could only deflect it down on to the stumps
slightly back of a length, goes back and nearly drags on as well, bounces wide of leg stump for a single
beautiful line from Anderson, lifting off the deck and zipping past MacLeod's outside edge as he sits back in the crease
length ball in the corridor, shapes away a fraction, cross-batted towards mid-off
nice shape on this delivery, angled in and then nibbling away, gently pace but Machan can't get any bat on that
length ball, too wide this time, Machan frees up his arms and slaps four in front of point
remains slightly wide, again Machan skips forwards and frees up his arms, swings and misses
on the stumps, blocked short on the leg side
touch short, nips back in from outside off, chopped into the covers for a single
length ball, fired across outside off, comes forward and swats one behind point
Macleod gets on the front foot, opens his shoulders and punches a length ball hard but straight to cover
not going off the straight for Anderson, length ball around off, gets an inside edge on to his front pad
MacLeod steps away, takes aim at a slightly full ball and clouts a straight four through mid-off, powerfully struck

bowled him, quick and straight, MacLeod had gone too far across! Anderson's pace is too much for both Scotland openers, this pinged the top of middle and leg as MacLeod shuffled across and tried to clip off his pads
fullish, outside off and this just holds its line, beats Coetzer's lavish drive
in the corridor outside off, Machan plays short on the off sie
beaten, this time by Gurney seaming the ball away from the batsman, teasing line and the ball jerks past the outside edge
shorter and straighter, tapped down from the crease
again dabbed off the back foot into the off side, can't get it off the square
Gurney goes a little wider, Machan again leaves his crease and has a wild, unsuccessful heave
touch short again, squirts one in front of square to deny Gurney a maiden
on the pads, Machan clips a single through square
pitched up on middle and off, Coetzer gets on the front foot and pushes defensively towards mid-on
Anderson follows Coetzer down the leg side, gets a tickle of bat on to pad and the ball rolls away for a single
pushed across the left-handed Machan, who flirts with the ball before drawing his bat inside
length in the channel, steered down to third man

edged and dropped by Buttler! Wicked delivery from Anderson, straightening late on Coetzer as he tried to flick to leg, took a chunk of bat and flew quite quickly to Buttler, who seemed to be surprised by it and coughed the ball straight up
short and room enough for Machan to swing his arms, picks out mid-on
even shorter and wider, no need for Machan to move his feet, just slaps a boundary through the packed off-side field
pitched up a little straighter, blocked back in front of leg stump
Machan gives Jordan the charge, lofts the ball over mid-on and there's enough bat to clear Root, running back, who then can't flick the ball away from the rope, four more to the total
fullish on leg stump, glanced through midwicket for one
swing and a miss from the batsman, didn't get in line and the ball darts through to the keeper
length ball angled across, Machan slices a single down to third man
on the stumps, shovelled somewhat agriculturally on the up but Coetzer clears mid-on and the ball skips away for four
drags his length back, blocked into the leg side from the crease
that's a jaffa! Touch short of a length, pitches on middle and off and sears past Coetzer's honest attempted push
manages to steer this one away through square leg
short of a length, on the stumps, Machan defends it down on to the pitch

Buttler catches this one, Jordan thinks he's got him, starts celebrating and then eventually appeals but Mark Hawthorne isn't having it. There was a sound, good delivery, just decking away as Coetzer pushed at it, not an obvious nick though
makes some room and heaves down the ground, gets a thick edge in the air down towards third man
Machan backs away to leg, Jordan follows him and digs the ball in short, blocked awkwardly
pushed across, poked short into the covers
length ball, again dropped in front of square, Morgan gets to it and hits the stumps with his throw but Coetzer was home
round the wicket, tossed up and Machan plays a natty reverse sweep, in the air for a moment but fine of short third man and runs for four
flatter delivery, comes forward and taps one through mid-on
floated up, drifting from leg to off from around the wicket, Coetzer sweeps through backward square
full and on the stumps, Machan again reverse sweeps, gets one to the edge of the circle

another one bowled, this time via Coetzer's forearms, I think... Tredwell was bowling outside leg stump, the ball skidded on as Coetzer tried to sweep, through the shot slightly early and managed to divert it on to his wicket
full and flighted on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
wicket to wicket, defended down the track
out the back of the hand, Machan waits and gets an inside edge to fine leg
he's picked this one up, swivels on a sixpence and carts Bopara over deep square leg, there's a man out there but he'll not be getting to it
opens the face and runs a single down to third man
slower ball, swings across the line and gets one through midwicket
loopy slower ball, out the back of the hand, wide-ish but Leask is through the shot far too quickly
floated up, swept through square for a single
drifted towards off stump from around the wicket, Leaks bunts a single down the ground to long-off
slow offbreak, gives this a bit of air, Machan waits and sweeps hard from outside off between long-on and deep midwicket
steers another single through midwicket
flat trajectory, Leask comes forward and rattles the wrists through a cover drive, nicely timed and the ball races through a gap for four
full and outside leg stump, plants the front foot and gives Tredwell the full gun over deep backward square, six more to the cause!
Ravi's slower ball does for Machan, top-edged straight up into the air! Swung hard but he was early on it, a skier came down around mid-on, where Bell had time to settle under it and pouch the catch
ooff, beats him outside off, skidding on and nearly clips the pole too
another slower ball, another maximum for Leask! Got under it a little but carried all the way down the ground, clean swing of the arms
full and straight, Leask throws the bat again, gets an inside edge past the keeper for four more!
on the stumps, backs away and crunches the ball flat down the ground, just one this time
tossed up... and Leask hits this to the moon! What a sweet strike, skips out and launches Tredwell for a huge straight six
tossed up, around off stump, Leask charges out and batters six more over cow corner! Brutal strike, Leask has got some rocket fuel on board today, thumping his fifth six from just 13 balls
Tredwell goes over the wicket, pushed on outside off, Leask cuts to backward point, gets sent back by Mommsen as the throw comes in
pushed through around off stump, punched firmly but flat down the ground to long-off
on the stumps, Mommsen waits and nurdles one round the corner

Leask takes on Tredwell again, tries to smoke him for six more over midwicket, gets plenty on it... but can't quite clear Anderson on the boundary! Another good jumping take, well judged a foot or two in from the rope
length ball outside off, works a single through the covers
leg-stump line, can't get this through
fullish, on the pads, clips two through midwicket
length ball, on off stump and just shaping back a touch, Mommsen punches back down the track
pitched up a little more, Mommsen swings hard but drills the ball to mid-off
rolls his fingers over this one and the batsman swings and misses, bobbles through outside off
angled in with the arm, pushed for one

slogged high towards long-on, this hasn't got the legs and Jordan backpedals underneath it to complete the dismissal! Second wicket for Tredwell, reward for his perseverance. Scotland in a bit of trouble now
tossed up and whipped through midwicket, lot of bottom hand in that shot, boundary for Mommsen
tossed up and sweeps hard, picks out the fielder behind square for a single
Davey goes first ball, reverse sweeping but a top edge sends it straight to short third man!
round the wicket, angled in and straightening outside off, solid forward defensive
stops in the pitch and Mommsen pops the ball back, just short of the bowler
on the stumps, goes across and flicks one through square leg
goes around the wicket, Haq pushes the ball into the off side
length on the stumps, quickish and defended half forwards
another slower delivery out the back of the hand, Haq swings and bottom edges into the keeper's pads
another slower ball, leg-stump line, hits the pads and loops short to the on side
bowled him, Scotland eight down! This will not be their Bannockburn... Angled in, maybe dipping back as Mommsen aimed an expansive shot down the ground, leg stump ends up at a wonky angle
slightly back of a length, played from the crease into the off side
over the top of the stumps, Wardlaw backs away again and taps into the off side
bit of width, Wardlaw swings hard and top edges the ball down to third man
comes forward, pushes defensively into the off side
pushed across the left-handed Haq, who guides it to third man for another single
continues around the wicket, pitched up and Haq slices a couple in the air past backward point
nudges one off the pads
takes the pace off again, straight at the stumps but Wardlaw realises in time, readjusts and taps one to short third man
another back-of-the-hand delivery, heading down the leg side, bit of bat and pad and for some daft reason Bopara thinks about appealing
gets forward and pushes in front of point, Wardlaw is struggling a little as the throw arrives from the diving Morgan but just manages to slide his bat in
pulls, comes high off the bat and it goes low to midwicket, where Jordan takes it above the grass. Second wicket for Bopara, smartly caught and the end is nigh
slightly full outside off, Haq sets himself and thumps the ball back past the bowler, beats the dive of mid-on and rolls gently up the hill for four
pushes the ball towards mid-off, a direct hit from Bopara would have ended things... but he missed
on the stumps, Alasdair Evans works the ball wide of mid-on, where Bopara doesn't collect it cleanly this time
short of a length, surprises Haq, who jabs it through midwicket
dug in again, Evans pulls and gets a top edge towards mid-on but it drops short
in the corridor, short again, Evans swings across the line and gets a top-edged four over the slips
touch short and pulled firmly through midwicket for a couple
short again and clubbed again, this time higher and harder for a one-bounce four to deep midwicket
well-directed yorker, manages to dig it out for one on the leg side
does him with a change of pace, swings and misses as the ball bounces through
back of a length, pulls to mid-on, no run
full and straight, Evans backs away and clouts four past mid-on - the innings ends with a brief fart of defiance but can't prevent England recording a 39-run win
